intro: Worcesterianthus, commonly known as the Cape island flower, is a genus of flowering plants native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow, white, and red. Worcesterianthus species are often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to their ornamental value, some species are cultivated in gardens, although they are relatively rare in horticulture.
